memberdef.definition: using learnql::core::Table< T, BatchSize >::primary_key_type = typename T::primary_key_type
memberdef.name: primary_key_type

briefdescription.para: Storage engine (shared).
Table name.
Persistent B-Tree index (primary key).
Secondary indexes.
Record count.
System catalog (not owned).

memberdef.argsstring: (std::shared_ptr< storage::StorageEngine > storage, std::string table_name, uint64_t root_page_id=0)
memberdef.name: Table

briefdescription.para: Constructs a table.

parameterdescription.para: Root page ID for the B-tree index (0 for new table)

briefdescription.para: Destructor - flushes index.
Inserts a new record.

parameterdescription.para: if a record with this primary key already exists

briefdescription.para: Updates an existing record.
Removes a record by primary key.

parameterdescription.para: Primary key of record to remove

simplesect.para: true if record was removed, false if not found

briefdescription.para: Finds a record by primary key.

simplesect.para: Pointer to record, or nullptr if not found

briefdescription.para: Checks if a record exists.
Gets the RecordId for a given primary key.

detaileddescription.para:
key
Primary key to look up
Optional RecordId if the key exists
This is useful for:
Populating secondary indexes from existing data
Direct page-level operations
Custom index implementations

briefdescription.para: Adds a secondary index on a field.

detaileddescription.para:
FieldType
Type of the indexed field
field
Static Field object (auto-generated by LEARNQL_PROPERTY)
type
Index type (Unique or MultiValue)
Reference to this table for method chaining
Creates a persistent secondary index on the specified field. The index is automatically synchronized on all CRUD operations.

briefdescription.para: Removes a secondary index on a field.

detaileddescription.para: Implementation of Table::drop_index().

FieldType
Type of the indexed field
field
Static Field object
true if index was found and removed
Example: students.drop_index(Student::email);
Must be defined after SystemCatalog is fully defined

memberdef.argsstring: (const query::Field< T, FieldType > &field, const FieldType &value) const
memberdef.name: find_by

briefdescription.para: Finds a single record by indexed field value (unique index).

detaileddescription.para:
FieldType
Type of the indexed field
field
Static Field object
value
Value to search for
Optional record if found
This method uses a unique secondary index for O(log n) lookup.

memberdef.argsstring: (const query::Field< T, FieldType > &field, const FieldType &value) const
memberdef.name: find_all_by

briefdescription.para: Finds all records by indexed field value (multi-value index).

detaileddescription.para:
FieldType
Type of the indexed field
field
Static Field object
value
Value to search for
Vector of matching records
This method uses a multi-value secondary index for O(log n) lookup.

briefdescription.para: Gets all unique values from a multi-value indexed field.

memberdef.argsstring: (const query::Field< T, FieldType > &field, const FieldType &min_value, const FieldType &max_value) const
memberdef.name: range_query

briefdescription.para: Performs a range query on an indexed field.

detaileddescription.para:
FieldType
Type of the indexed field
field
Static Field object
min_value
Minimum value (inclusive)
max_value
Maximum value (exclusive)
Vector of matching records
Example: autonames_a_m=students.range_query(Student::name,"A","M");

briefdescription.para: Gets the number of records in the table.
Checks if the table is empty.
Clears all records from the table.

memberdef.definition: ranges::ProxyVector< T, BatchSize > learnql::core::Table< T, BatchSize >::find_if
memberdef.name: find_if

briefdescription.para: Finds all records matching a predicate.

simplesect.para: ProxyVector of matching records (loaded in batches)

memberdef.definition: ranges::ProxyVector< T, BatchSize > learnql::core::Table< T, BatchSize >::get_all
memberdef.name: get_all

briefdescription.para: Gets all records.

simplesect.para: ProxyVector of all records (loaded in batches)

briefdescription.para: Creates a query builder for this table (for Phase 3).

detaileddescription.para: Implementation of Table::where() for expression templates.

Query builder
Forward declaration - implementation requires Query.hpp
This needs to be defined after Query is fully defined
Include Query.hpp before using this method

briefdescription.para: Creates a range view of all records (Phase 4).

detaileddescription.para:
QueryView of all records
This enables using C++20 ranges with the table: autonames=students.view() |std::views::filter([](auto&s){returns.age>20;}) |std::views::transform([](auto&s){returns.name;});

briefdescription.para: Alias for view() - returns all records as a range.
Creates a range view of records matching an expression.

detaileddescription.para:
ExprType
Expression type
expr
Expression to filter with
QueryView of matching records
Example: autoresults=students.view_where(age>20) |std::views::transform([](auto&s){returns.name;});

briefdescription.para: Gets the table name.
Iterator to beginning (with batched loading).

detaileddescription.para: Returns an iterator that loads record IDs in batches, making iteration memory-efficient for large tables.

briefdescription.para: Iterator to end.
Flushes all changes to disk.

detaileddescription.para: Flushes primary index, all secondary indexes, and storage engine.

briefdescription.para: Gets the root page ID of the table's B-tree index.
Sets the system catalog for metadata sync.

detaileddescription.para:
catalog
Pointer to system catalog (not owned)
Called by Database after table creation to enable automatic record count synchronization.

memberdef.definition: Table< T, BatchSize > & learnql::core::Table< T, BatchSize >::add_index
memberdef.name: add_index

briefdescription.para: Implementation of Table::add_index().

detaileddescription.para: Must be defined after SystemCatalog is fully defined

briefdescription.para: Loads a record from storage.
Synchronize record count with system catalog.

detaileddescription.para: Implementation of Table::sync_catalog_count().
Defined after SystemCatalog include to avoid incomplete type error
Must be defined after SystemCatalog is fully defined

briefdescription.para: Type-safe table for storing objects of type T.

detaileddescription.para:
T
Type of objects to store (must satisfy Queryable concept)
BatchSize
Number of record IDs to load per batch (default: 10)
Features:
Compile-time type checking via concepts
CRUD operations: insert, update, remove, find
Primary key-based indexing
Secondary indexes with automatic synchronization (NEW!)
Iterator support for range-based loops
Integration with storage engine
Lazy batch loading (records loaded in configurable batches)
Memory-efficient traversal
